attributes.action: Answer all Questions Honestly without Avoidance.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK public deserve to be told exactly what is going in their own country with the exception of national secrets and UK security. 
MPs have for too long been able to avoid answering questions by confusing the question at hand. a simple yes (with reason), No (with reason) or I don't know (And what the intend to do next) would
attributes.background:
Insist in Law, that Any MP when asked a direct interview question should only be allowed, to answer Yes, No or I don’t know.
This will give full accountability to the public and will show true leadership or failure within any working party.
Giving the public real data to vote with.

rejection.details:
How MPs answers questions is a matter for individual MPs, not the Government or Parliament.

MPs are subject to the House of Commons Code of Conduct, of which honesty is one of the general principles of conduct. The Committee on Standards and the Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards can investigate complaints about breaches of the Code of Conduct.
